french.enphrase: What happened? Your hair is a mess!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Que t'est-il arrivé ? Tu as les cheveux en bataille !

french.enphrase: I found this lampshade from the 19th century at an antiques fair: it's a collector's item.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Lors d'une brocante, j'ai trouvé cet abat-jour du 19è siècle, c'est une pièce rare.

french.enphrase: The cat spilt its milk so I'll ask the housekeeper to mop the floor.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le chat a renversé son lait, je demanderai alors à la femme de ménage de passer la serpillère.

french.enphrase: Italians are known to be very welcoming people.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les Italiens sont réputés pour être des gens très accueillants.

french.enphrase: She was fired by her boss because some of her colleagues said she was taking it easy.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Elle a été renvoyée par son patron car certains de ses collègues disaient qu'elle se la coulait douce.

french.enphrase: I'd thought it would be simple, otherwise I wouldn't have asked you replace me!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je pensais que ce serait simple, autrement je ne t'aurais pas demander de me remplacer !

french.enphrase: We're moving! You'd better help us instead of twiddling your thumbs!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous déménageons ! Tu ferais mieux de nous aider au lieu de te tourner les pouces !

french.enphrase: My neighbor's engagement party was a great success!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La fête de fiançailles de mes voisins était particulièrement réussie !

french.enphrase: Many matrimonial agencies promise to find you a soul mate, but this is not an easy task.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: De nombreuses agences matrimoniales vous promettent de trouver l'âme sœur, mais ce n'est pas une tâche aisée.

french.enphrase: Some days require more coffee than others.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Certains jours exigent plus de café que d'autres.

french.enphrase: My new boss is very finicky; I'm not sure we will be able to get along.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mon nouveau patron est très tatillon, je ne suis pas sûre que nous allons nous entendre.

french.enphrase: For this new job my brother is torn between his work and his family.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Dans son nouveau poste, mon frère est tiraillé entre son travail et sa famille.

french.enphrase: Parisians like strolling in the streets of Montmartre, it's a unique and peaceful place.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les Parisiens aiment flâner dans les rues de Montmartre, c'est un endroit original et apaisant.

french.enphrase: These new retirees organize a knitting workshop every Wednesday afternoon.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ces jeunes retraités organisent un atelier tricot tous les mercredis après-midis.

french.enphrase: After courting her for months, Paul finally proposed to Sophie on Valentine's Day.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Après l'avoir courtisée pendant des mois, Paul a enfin demandé Sophie en mariage le jour de la Saint-Valentin.

french.enphrase: My sister was dating a very nice guy, she dumped him without any explanation.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ma sœur fréquentait un type très gentil, elle l'a laissé tomber sans explication.

french.enphrase: My niece idolizes her mother, there's nobody more important in the world.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ma nièce idolâtre sa mère, il n'y a personne de plus important au monde.

french.enphrase: The red flag was hoisted on the beach this morning because of the high risk of drowning.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le drapeau rouge a été hissé sur la plage en raison du risque de noyade.

french.enphrase: Some say that life is a highway.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Certains disent que la vie est une autoroute.

french.enphrase: All the fruits served for lunch come from my neighbor's orchard.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Tous les fruits servis au déjeuner viennent du verger de mon voisin.

french.translation: to dabble in the stock market
french.enphrase: Since my cousin dabbles in stocks and shares he has lost more than two thousand Euros!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Depuis que mon cousin boursicote, il a perdu plus de deux mille euros !

french.enphrase: The teacher distributes stickers to reward the pupils for their good work.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La maîtresse distribue des gommettes pour récompenser les élèves de leur bon travail.

french.enphrase: The major TV channel spread the news in less than one hour.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La 1ère chaine de télévision nationale a propagé la nouvelle en moins d'une heure.

french.enphrase: Under the witches' spell, the charming prince turned into a toad.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Sous le sort des sorcières, le prince charmant se transforma en crapaud.

french.enphrase: In the Middle Ages, servants were scourged if the work was not done properly.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Au Moyen-âge on flagellait les servants si le travail n'était pas fait correctement.

french.enphrase: My son met the president of the French Republic, he was so impressed that he could barely talk.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mon fils a rencontré le Président de la République, il était si impressionné qu'il pouvait à peine parler.

french.enphrase: It's funny to watch the toddlers crawling in the yard!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 11 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: C'est amusant de regarder les bambins crapahuter dans la cour !

french.enphrase: Something old, something new, something borrowed, something blue.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Quelque chose de vieux, quelque chose de nouveau, quelque chose emprunté, quelque chose bleue.

french.enphrase: After breaking her leg, my aunt had to stay bedridden for weeks.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Après s'être cassé la jambe, ma tante a dû rester alitée pendant des semaines.

french.enphrase: My nephew is a bit whiny tonight, but it's because he is very tired.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mon neveu est un peu pleurnichard ce soir, mais c'est parce qu'il est très fatigué.

french.enphrase: Since his wife's death, my uncle has become a misfit; he no longer sees anyone.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Depuis la mort de sa femme, mon oncle est un vrai marginal ; il ne voit plus personne.

french.enphrase: I know he hurt you but he didn't do it on purpose, I don't think he's evil-minded.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je sais qu'il t'a blessé, mais il ne l'a pas fait exprès, je ne pense pas qu'il soit malveillant.

french.enphrase: My mother brought me some spices from the West Indies to liven up the sauce of my dishes.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ma mère m'a apporté des épices des Antilles pour agrémenter mes plats en sauce.

french.enphrase: The scarecrow in my grandfather's field is really scary, that's why you'll see no birds over there.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: L'épouvantail dans le champs de mon grand-père est vraiment effrayant, c'est pourquoi tu n'y verras aucun oiseau.

french.enphrase: In France, every good meal starts with a drink!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: En France, tout bon repas commence par un apéritif !

french.enphrase: If we consider the whole universe, our planet Earth is a tiny dot in space.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Si l'on considère l'univers tout entier, notre planète Terre est un point minuscule dans l'espace.

french.translation: to be a piece of cake
french.enphrase: Navigating this labyrinth is a piece of cake!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Naviguant ce labirynthe est une tache facile!

french.enphrase: How many times have I asked you not to tease your sister!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Combien de fois t'ai-je demandé de ne pas taquiner ta sœur !

french.enphrase: Cashew nuts are delicious but they're not good for your health.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les noix de cajou sont délicieuses mais ce n'est pas un aliment bon pour la santé.

french.enphrase: Have you ever seen the view from the top of a dam? It's fantastic!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Avez-vous déjà admiré la vue depuis le haut d'un barrage ? C'est fantastique !

french.enphrase: During a nice summer afternoon in Paris, you'll see plenty of tour boats cruising on the river Seine.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: En été à Paris, par un bel après-midi, vous apercevrez une multitude de bateaux-mouches sur la Seine.

french.enphrase: When we were young, it wasn't rare for us to play hooky to go run in the country fields.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Quand nous étions jeunes, il n'était pas rare que nous fassions l'école buissonnière pour aller courir dans les prés.

french.enphrase: Could you articulate properly? I can't understand your muttering.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Peux-tu articuler correctement, je ne comprends pas tes balbutiements.

french.enphrase: It is now possible to have many surgeries as an outpatient, and it is much more convenient.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Désormais, de nombreuses interventions chirurgicales peuvent se faire en ambulatoire, et cela est bien plus pratique.

french.enphrase: I was stunned when she told me about all she has gone through to get here.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'étais stupéfaite lorsqu'elle m'a raconté tout ce qu'elle a enduré pour arriver jusqu'ici.

french.enphrase: A storm watch is on, we'll have to insulate the doors and the windows in order to avoid the drafts.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Un avis de tempête a été lancé, il faudra calfeutrer les portes et les fenêtres afin d'éviter les courants d'air.

french.enphrase: This kid is a rogue; he plays bad tricks all day long.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Cet enfant est un vrai chenapan, il fait de vilaines blagues à longueur de journée.

french.enphrase: The first three contestants received a trophy, and in the spirit of fairness the others received a little medal.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les 3 premiers ont reçu un trophée et dans un souci d'équité, tous les participants ont reçu une petite médaille.

french.enphrase: The stolen merchandise was hidden in a shelter in the country.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La marchandise volée était cachée dans un abri à la campagne.

french.enphrase: The entrance of the swimming area is limited by those yellow buoys you can see over there.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: L'entrée de la zone de baignade est délimitée par les bouées jaunes que l'on aperçoit là-bas.

french.enphrase: Swimming is permitted in this area but you still have to be careful of the current.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La baignade est autorisée dans cette zone mais il faut tout de même faire attention au courant.

french.enphrase: My cousin has a very nice collection of candle holders in which she displays scented candles.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ma cousine a une superbe collection de bougeoirs dans lesquelles elle dispose des bougies parfumées.

french.enphrase: This affair, which seemed to be one of the most serious, turned out to be only a masquerade.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Cette affaire qui semblait une des plus sérieuses s'est avérée n'être qu'une mascarade.

french.enphrase: The truth is out there.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La vérité existe quelque part.

french.enphrase: The mayor of this quiet little town is being taken to court on a bribery charge.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 12 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le maire de cette petite ville tranquille est poursuivi pour une affaire de pots-de-vin.

french.enphrase: This Monet, a real masterpiece, has been sold at auction for more than 4 million Euros.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ce Monet, une véritable toile de maître, a été vendu aux enchères pour plus de 4 millions d'euros.

french.enphrase: The European headquarters of the company have sent a specialized investigator concerning accounting problems.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le siège européen de la société a envoyé un enquêteur spécialisé concernant les problèmes de comptabilité.

french.enphrase: When I entered into the manor I immediately noticed the magnificent chandelier in the entrance hall.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Quand je suis entré dans le manoir, j'ai tout de suite remarqué le magnifique chandelier de l'entrée.

french.enphrase: After washing my clothes time after time at too high a temperature, their color faded.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: A force de laver mes vêtements à trop haute température, ils sont délavés.

french.enphrase: The plumber had left his workbench in the garage and my son hurt himself with one of his tools.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le plombier avait laissé son établi dans le garage et mon fils s'est blessé avec l'un de ses outils.

french.enphrase: This student was reprimanded by the junior high school principal because of his bad behavior during the French class.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Cet élève a été réprimandé par le principal du collège suite à sa mauvaise conduite en classe de Français.

french.enphrase: The "Vigipirate" Plan was set up in the large cities of France to protect the country from potential terrorist attacks.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le plan Vigipirate a été instauré dans les grandes villes de France afin de protéger le pays d'éventuels attentats.

french.enphrase: There's nothing more practical than wireless technology!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il n'y a rien de plus pratique que la technologie sans-fil !

french.enphrase: We really appreciate her cheerful attitude in any situation.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous apprécions beaucoup son attitude enjouée en toute situation.

french.enphrase: His parents own a cattle ranch with 550 head of cattle.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ses parents possèdent un élevage bovin de 550 bêtes.

french.enphrase: A lot more children than you can imagine suffer from malnutrition in France.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Bien plus d'enfants que tu ne peux imaginer sont mal nourris en France.

french.enphrase: The town hall department planted birches along the road.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les services de la mairie ont planté des bouleaux tout au long de la route.

french.enphrase: She has the habit of looking people up and down.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Elle a pour habitude de toiser les gens.

french.enphrase: To avoid wrinkled clothes, it's preferable to use the clothes dryer.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Pour éviter les vêtements froissés, il est préférable d' utiliser le sèche-linge.

french.enphrase: My husband is Italian; all my in-laws live in Milan.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mon mari est Italien ; toute ma belle-famille vit à Milan.

french.enphrase: Why'd you block me on Twitter, friend?
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Pourquoi me bloquerais-tu sur Twitter, mon ami?

french.enphrase: Whereas most houses in the US are made of wood, in France they are very often made of cinder block.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Alors qu'aux Etats-Unis la plupart des maisons sont en bois, en France elles sont très souvent en parpaings.

french.enphrase: The subway conductors are on strike, but shuttles insure a connection between the city center and the train station.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les conducteurs de métro sont en grève mais des navettes assurent la liaison entre le centre-ville et la gare.

french.enphrase: After the plane crash, the passengers were able to reach the beach thanks to the life boats.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Après le crash de l'avion, les passagers ont pu rejoindre la plage grâce aux radeaux de survie.

french.enphrase: Our boss is quite impulsive; it is as much of a quality as it is a fault.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Notre patron est assez primesautier ; c'est autant une qualité qu'un défaut.

french.enphrase: The two enemy camps agreed to a 48 hour truce to evacuate the wounded.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les deux camps ennemis se sont accordé une trêve de 48 heures pour évacuer les blessés.

french.enphrase: It's only October and we already have winter temperatures!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous sommes seulement en Octobre et nous avons déjà des températures hivernales !

french.enphrase: I stood petrified upon hearing the terrible news.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je suis restée médusée à l'annonce de la terrible nouvelle.

french.enphrase: I envy her because her closet can hold thousands of clothes.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je l'envie parce que sa penderie peut contenir des milliers de vêtements !

french.enphrase: The teacher doesn't accept that you turn in an incomplete homework assignment.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le maître d'école n'accepte pas que l'on rende un devoir inachevé.

french.enphrase: My daughter loves the jigsaw puzzle you gave her; she keeps undoing it so that she can start it again.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ma fille adore le puzzle que vous lui avez offert ; elle ne cesse de le défaire pour pouvoir le recommencer.

french.enphrase: Since he was a very young, he has not had a big appetite, which explains why he is a bit puny.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Depuis sa plus tendre enfance il n'a pas grand appétit, ce qui explique pourquoi il est un peu chétif.

french.enphrase: The policeman looked at him sideways, then kept going on his way without stopping.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 13 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le policier lui jeta un regard de côté puis continua sa route sans s'arrêter.

french.enphrase: I must confess that I am rather grumpy if I don't get enough sleep.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je dois avouer que je suis assez grognon si je ne dors pas assez.

french.enphrase: Before attacking one's opponent it is important to know his weak point.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Avant d'attaquer son adversaire il est important de connaître son point faible.

french.enphrase: It's not the heat, it's the humidity.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ce n'est pas la chaleur, c'est l'humidité.

french.enphrase: A new plot against the president has been foiled by the Intelligence Services.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Un nouveau complot visant le Président a été déjoué par les Renseignements Généraux.

french.enphrase: He handles two jobs: he works in an office downtown, and at the same time he manages an online sales site.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il cumule deux emplois ; il travaille dans un bureau au centre-ville et s'occupe parallèlement d'une boutique en ligne sur internet.

french.enphrase: The library closes at 4:30pm, whereas she leaves school at 5pm, therefore she won't be able to work there.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La bibliothèque ferme ses portes à 16h30 alors qu'elle sort de l'école à 17h, donc elle ne pourra pas aller y travailler.

french.enphrase: For the most part, toys for toddlers are unbreakable.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les jouets pour les tout-petits sont pour la plupart incassables.

french.enphrase: After this argument we left upset with each other, and I really feel misunderstood.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Après cette dispute nous nous sommes quittés fâchés et je me sens vraiment incomprise.

french.enphrase: During an economic crisis, bankruptcy is sometimes unavoidable.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Pendant une crise économique, la faillite est parfois inévitable.

french.enphrase: I can't work with these people!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je ne peux pas travailler avec ces gens !

french.enphrase: A good cover letter will motivate the employer to read your resume.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Une bonne lettre de motivation donnera envie à l'employeur de lire votre curriculum vitae.

french.enphrase: I can't seem to get along with my cousin; her attitude is so childish.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je n'arrive pas à m'entendre avec ma cousine, elle a une attitude si puérile !

french.enphrase: This young artist sculpts in concrete; his works are very distinctive.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ce jeune artiste sculpte dans du béton ; ses œuvres sont très particulières.

french.enphrase: This playground is very complete: there are two swings, a slide, and even a see-saw.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ce terrain de jeux est très complet ; il y a deux balançoires, un toboggan et même un tape-cul.

french.enphrase: This charity dinner has garnered thousands of Euros for cancer research.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ce repas de charité a permis de récolter des milliers d'euros pour la recherche contre le cancer.

french.enphrase: We created a non-profit association which offers "French as a Foreign Language" classes to newcomers.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous avons crée une association à but non-lucratif qui propose des cours de "Français comme Langue Etrangère" aux nouveaux arrivants.

french.enphrase: Dictations allow the teachers to test the level of their pupils' spelling skills.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les dictées permettent aux professeurs d'évaluer le niveau d'orthographe de leurs élèves.

french.enphrase: My work here is done.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mon travail ici est terminé.

french.enphrase: Sign language is essential for the deaf and hard of hearing.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le langage des signes est indispensable pour les personnes sourdes et malentendantes.

french.enphrase: Throughout history numerous epidemics have threatened mankind, but so far no solution has been found.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Tout au long de l'histoire, de nombreux fléaux ont menacé l'humanité, mais jusqu'alors aucune solution n'a jamais été trouvée.

french.enphrase: The accounting department and human resources are working together on this file.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le service comptabilité et le service ressources humaines travaillent ensemble sur ce dossier.

french.enphrase: After the CEO's presentation of the company's results, the staff was speechless.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Après le discours du directeur général sur les résultats de l'entreprise, l'équipe est restée sans voix.

french.enphrase: This art school will close if we don't quickly find a benefactor who brings some funds.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Cette école d'art fermera si on ne lui trouve pas rapidement un bienfaiteur qui apporte des fonds.

french.enphrase: My sister-in-law is very tired and runs the risk of premature delivery; this is why she needs a lot of rest.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ma belle-sœur est très fatiguée et risque un accouchement prématuré ; c'est pourquoi il lui faut beaucoup de repos.

french.enphrase: This school opened a special class for gifted children where the education is better adapted to their needs.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Cette école a ouvert une classe spécialement pour les enfants surdoués où l'enseignement est mieux adapté à leurs besoins.

french.enphrase: Look at how this little girl knits her eyebrows when she is dissatisfied; she's so funny!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Regarde comme cette petite fille fronce les sourcils quand elle est insatisfaite ; elle est si drôle !

french.enphrase: I'll get you, my pretty, and your little dog, too!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je vous aurai ma jolie, et votre petit chien, aussi !

french.enphrase: What a pity! Lucie has straightened her hair! She had such nice curls!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 14 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Quel dommage ! Lucie a lissé ses cheveux ! Elle qui avait de si jolies boucles !

french.enphrase: I've dyed my old clothes and now they look brand new!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'ai teint mes vieux vêtements et maintenant ils ont l'air comme neufs !

french.enphrase: He wanted so much to get rid of his car that he gave it away cheap to the first buyer he found.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il voulait tellement se débarrasser de sa voiture qu'il l'a cédée à vil prix au premier acheteur trouvé.

french.enphrase: The kids play horsey, riding astride their father's knees.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les enfants jouent au cheval à califourchon sur les genoux de leur père.

french.enphrase: After fighting against this disease for years he passed away this morning.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Après avoir lutté contre la maladie pendant des années il a trépassé ce matin.

french.enphrase: My father, who knows a lot about woodworking, made a beautiful cradle for my baby.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mon père, qui s'y connaît bien pour travailler le bois, m'a confectionné un très joli berceau pour mon bébé.

french.enphrase: The plane was routed to another airport because of the bad weather.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: L'avion a été dérouté vers un autre aéroport pour cause de mauvais temps.

french.enphrase: Because a storm has been raging in the region for 24 hours, you are advised not to use your car.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Parce qu'une tempête sévit sur la région depuis 24 heures il est recommandé de ne pas utiliser sa voiture.

french.enphrase: My cousin has been hired as a forklift operator at the chemical factory near his home.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mon cousin a été embauché comme cariste dans l'usine de produits chimiques près de chez lui.

french.enphrase: In fairy tales, princes often marry commoners.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Dans les contes de fées, les princes épousent souvent des roturières.

french.enphrase: I am a perfectionist, and I always spend a lot of time polishing up my work.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je suis perfectionniste et je passe toujours du temps à peaufiner mon travail.

french.enphrase: To get this nice villa for themselves, they took out a 30 year mortgage.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Pour s'offrir cette belle villa, ils ont pris un prêt immobilier sur 30 ans.

french.enphrase: They have been craftsmen for 30 years, father and son, and their knowledge is huge.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ils sont artisans de père en fils depuis trente ans et leur savoir-faire est immense.

french.enphrase: In spite of all the technological progress, we will always need manual labor.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Malgré tout les progrès de la technologie, nous aurons toujours besoin de main-d'oeuvre.

french.enphrase: In short, all is well that ends well.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: En bref, tout est bien qui finit bien.

french.enphrase: Because of the video game explosion, board game sales have collapsed.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Avec l'explosion des jeux vidéos, les ventes de jeux de société se sont effondrées.

french.enphrase: He shows off all day long; never I have seen such boasting!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il se met en avant à longueur de journée ; jamais je n'ai vu une telle vantardise !

french.enphrase: My grandma used to teach us a new nursery rhyme every evening.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ma grand-mère avait pour habitude de nous apprendre une nouvelle comptine chaque soir.

french.enphrase: In Paris, Place Vendôme is famous for its luxury jewelers.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: A Paris, la place Vendôme est réputée pour ses nombreux bijoutiers de luxe.

french.enphrase: My brother-in-law is still single; he has a bachelor pad in Paris where he only receives his girlfriends.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mon beau-frère est toujours célibataire ; il a une garçonnière à Paris où il ne reçoit que ses amies.

french.enphrase: It is customary for the groom's best man to take charge of the bachelor party.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il est de coutume que le témoin du marié s'occupe de l'enterrement de vie de garçon.

french.enphrase: For our wedding anniversary I wanted to offer a hot air balloon ride to my wife, but she has vertigo.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Pour notre anniversaire de mariage je voulais offrir à ma femme un vol en montgolfière, mais elle a le vertige.

french.enphrase: They say time is the fire in which we burn.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: On dit que le temps est le feu en lequel nous brûlons.

french.enphrase: I have thought about the situation, and in my opinion we should go back to the beginning of the problem.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'ai réfléchi à la situation, et d'après moi nous devrions reprendre le problème depuis le début.

french.enphrase: The lack of serious work necessarily leads to failure.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le manque de travail sérieux conduit forcément à l'échec.

french.enphrase: My kids often download on the internet, and that is why I chose a good anti-virus shield.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mes enfants téléchargent beaucoup sur internet, et c'est pourquoi j'ai pris un bon bouclier anti-virus.

french.enphrase: I like the smell of the hot and crusty bread when I arrive at the baker's on Sunday.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'aime l'odeur du pain chaud et croustillant quand j'arrive chez le boulanger le dimanche.

french.enphrase: The birds in the garden are feasting on the crumbs I left for them.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les oiseaux dans le jardin se régalent des miettes que je leur ai laissées.

french.enphrase: The repeated showers had left many puddles in which the kids were merrily jumping.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les averses répétées avaient laissé de nombreuses flaques d'eau dans lesquelles les enfants sautaient joyeusement.

french.enphrase: It's necessary to book much in advance if you want to have dinner in this seafood restaurant.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il faut réserver bien en avance pour dîner dans ce restaurant de crustacés.

french.enphrase: I felt compassion for this little frightened animal; that's why I took it home with me.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'ai ressenti de la compassion pour ce petit animal craintif ; c'est pourquoi je l'ai ramené à la maison avec moi.

french.enphrase: It's a quite tempting offer; I'm really hesitant to refuse.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: C'est une offre plutôt alléchante, j'hésite vraiment à refuser.

french.enphrase: The orders having strongly increased, management decided to add to the night staff.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les commandes ayant fortement augmenté, la direction a renforcé l'équipe de nuit.

french.enphrase: Do you realize that we are depriving these poor people by seizing their car?
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Te rends-tu compte que nous démunissons ces pauvres gens en saisissant leur voiture ?

french.enphrase: The butcher is sharpening his knives before starting to cut his meat.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le boucher aiguise ses couteaux avant de commencer à couper sa viande.

french.enphrase: This long illness has weakened him a lot; he can barely leave his bed.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Cette longue maladie l'a énormément affaibli ; il peut à peine quitter son lit.

french.enphrase: The employees decided to lead a silent march downtown to protest.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les salariés ont décidé de conduire une marche silencieuse dans le centre-ville pour contester.

french.enphrase: No pain, no gain.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Pas de douleur, pas de gain

french.enphrase: Often children wake up during Christmas Eve to peek and try to see Santa Claus.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Souvent les enfants se lèvent pendant la nuit de Noël pour jeter un coup d'œil et tenter d'apercevoir le Père Noël.

french.enphrase: It is very rude to stare at people because it makes them feel uncomfortable.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il est très impoli de dévisager les gens car cela les met mal à l'aise.

french.enphrase: The teacher lets the kids knead the modeling clay so that they discover shapes and colors.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La maîtresse laisse les enfants tripatouiller la pâte à modeler de manière à ce qu'ils découvrent les formes et les couleurs.

french.enphrase: The qualification game for the soccer world championship will be broadcast on a major TV channel.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le match de la qualification pour la coupe du monde de football sera retransmis sur une grande chaîne nationale.

french.enphrase: My grandfather's rocking chair was squeaking back and forth and was putting us to sleep as nicely as a lullaby.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le fauteuil à bascule de mon grand-père grinçait d'avant en arrière et nous endormait aussi bien qu'une berceuse.

french.enphrase: I can no longer stand these little bugs crawling along my bedroom wall.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je ne supporte plus ces petits insectes qui rampent le long du mur de ma chambre.

french.enphrase: The psychic had foreseen that a disaster was looming over the sleepy little town.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La voyante avait pressenti qu'un grand malheur guettait la petite ville endormie.

french.enphrase: I went to the bank to withdraw some money.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je suis passé à la banque pour retirer de l'argent.

french.enphrase: I hired a lady who comes every afternoon to converse with my aunt.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'ai engagé une dame de compagnie qui vient converser avec ma tante tous les après-midis.

french.enphrase: The company CEO gave a very complete speech; however he was contradicted many times by the board members.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le directeur de la société a effectué un discours très complet, cependant les membres du conseil d'administration l'ont beaucoup contredit.

french.enphrase: At the present time, I am taking English classes by phone because I wish to improve my English.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: En ce moment, je prends des cours par téléphone car je souhaite m'améliorer en anglais.

french.enphrase: With the legal analyses having revealed odd results, the winner of the race has been demoted to second place.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les analyses réglementaires n'étant pas claires, le gagnant de la course a été rétrogradé en seconde position.

french.enphrase: A door slammed loudly, and I shivered upon hearing steps approaching in the hallway.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Une porte se ferma bruyamment et je frissonnai en entendant des pas approcher dans le couloir.

french.enphrase: The tourists were hurrying onto the pier, waiting impatiently for the shuttle which would take them to the other side of the bay.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les touristes se pressaient sur l'embarcadère attendant impatiemment la navette qui les emmènerait de l'autre côté de la baie.

french.enphrase: Looks like someone has a case of the Mondays!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il semble que quelqu'un a la morosité du lundi !

french.enphrase: Temporary workers have been hired to take the store inventory.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Des intérimaires ont été embauchés pour assurer l'inventaire du magasin.

french.enphrase: During a heat wave it's essential to carry a cool water spray, especially for the most sensitive people.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Pendant la canicule, il est indispensable de porter sur soi un brumisateur d'eau fraîche, surtout pour les personnes les plus sensibles.

french.enphrase: The immune system is severely tested from the first days of winter.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le système immunitaire est mis à rude épreuve dès les premiers jours de l'hiver.

french.enphrase: We have to find an agreement; we are not going to procrastinate all afternoon.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il faut maintenant trouver un accord, nous n'allons pas tergiverser toute l'après-midi.

french.enphrase: In France, women have eight weeks of maternity leave.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 5 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: En France, les femmes ont un congé maternité de huit semaines.

french.enphrase: All the pupils are sitting at their desks for the morning attendance.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 5 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les élèves sont tous assis à leurs pupitres pour l'appel du matin.

french.enphrase: My cousins are patching up my old bike so that I can go join them for a ride.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 5 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mes cousins sont en train de rafistoler mon vieux vélo pour que je puisse participer à la ballade avec eux.

french.enphrase: Following the last gang confrontations, the police patrols come through the neighborhood every hour.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 5 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Suite aux derniers affrontements entre gangs, les patrouilles de police passent toutes les heures dans le quartier.

french.enphrase: You complete me.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 5 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Vous me completez.

french.enphrase: For her birthday, we offered my grandmother a pretty shopping bag to go to the supermarket.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 5 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Pour son anniversaire, nous avons offert un joli cabas à ma grand-mère pour aller au supermarché.

french.enphrase: A scrap metal merchant comes to the neighborhood twice a year.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 5 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Un ferrailleur passe dans notre quartier deux fois par an.

french.enphrase: Every year on New Year's Day, all the different TV channels present bloopers from the past year.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 5 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Tous les ans pour le Nouvel An, les différentes chaînes de télévision proposent un bêtisier de l'année écoulée.

french.enphrase: My uncle is well-known for being stingy; he has a lot of money, but he's afraid to spend it.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mon oncle est réputé pour être radin ; il a beaucoup d'argent mais il a peur de le dépenser.

french.enphrase: It's no use to ask anything of Pauline; she is a total scatterbrain.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ça ne sert à rien de demander quoique ce soit à Pauline ; elle est complètement étourdie.

french.enphrase: My niece was so hot that she was crimson.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ma nièce avait si chaud qu'elle était cramoisie.

french.enphrase: My boss is a very perceptive person; she understands things with just half a word.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ma patronne est une personne très perspicace ; elle comprend les choses à demi-mot.

french.enphrase: She's a bit plump; this is why she decided to go on a rather strict diet.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Elle est un peu grassouillette ; c'est pourquoi elle a décidé de suivre un régime assez strict.

french.enphrase: Baxter, you know I don't speak Spanish.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Baxter, vous savez que je ne parle pas l'espagnol.

french.enphrase: This morning the pupils learned to count backward from 20 to 0 to work on their memory.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ce matin, les élèves ont appris à compter à rebours de 20 à 0 pour travailler leur mémoire.

french.enphrase: Have you turned off the sink faucet? It seems to me that I hear water running!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: As-tu fermé le robinet de l'évier ? Il me semble entendre l'eau couler !

french.enphrase: The person who delivers packages to our office in the morning has a very loaded cart; it mustn't be easy.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le porteur qui livre les paquets à notre bureau le matin a un chariot très chargé ; ça ne doit pas être facile.

french.enphrase: This bookshop has a magnificent stationery department; I do my shopping there before each school year.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Cette librairie a un magnifique rayon papeterie ; j'y fais mes courses avant chaque rentrée.

french.enphrase: My boyfriend found a job as a reporter at the local newspaper.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mon petit ami a trouvé un emploi de pigiste dans le journal local.

french.enphrase: He's a real dunce; the teacher always puts him in the back of the classroom.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: C'est un vrai cancre ; le professeur le met toujours au fond de la classe.

french.enphrase: To reduce the speed approaching the town center, the town hall installed speed bumps in the main street.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Pour réduire la vitesse à l'approche du centre-ville, les services municipaux ont installé des dos d'âne sur la rue principale.

french.enphrase: I had to call the gardener again because my backyard is full of moles; it's very unpleasant.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'ai dû rappeler le jardinier une nouvelle fois car mon jardin est plein de taupes ; c'est très désagréable.

french.enphrase: I had to rent a cement mixer to make the terrace in my back yard because it's much faster.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'ai dû louer une bétonnière pour faire la terrasse dans mon jardin car c'est beaucoup plus rapide.

french.enphrase: For my first paid leave of the year I am leaving for Brittany for ten days; I can't wait.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Pour mes premiers congés payés de l'année, je pars dix jours en Bretagne ; j'ai hâte !

french.enphrase: At my office we habitually schedule everyone's holidays at the beginning of the year.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: A mon bureau nous avons l'habitude de planifier les congés de chacun en début d'année.

french.enphrase: This craftsman is impressive; he embosses all sorts of materials.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Cet artisan est impressionnant ; il gaufre toute sortes de matériaux.

french.enphrase: The old friends were smiling, remembering how they were frolicking on the beach during their childhood.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les vieux amis souriaient en se souvenant comme ils batifolaient sur la plage pendant leur enfance.

french.enphrase: The employee was very upset when he realized that his boss was deducting overtime hours.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: L'employé était très en colère quand il s'est rendu compte que son patron décomptait les heures supplémentaires.

french.enphrase: When you are in court, you need to provide strong arguments in order to be able to prove your innocence.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Lorsque que vous êtes au tribunal vous devez posséder de solides arguments afin de pouvoir démontrer votre innocence.

french.enphrase: You're going to need a bigger boat.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Vous allez avoir besoin d'un bateau plus grand.

french.enphrase: The acrobat's act amazed all the circus audience.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le numéro d'acrobate a époustouflé tous les spectateurs du cirque.

french.enphrase: From their first few months, babies paddle merrily in their baths.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Dès leurs premiers mois les bébés barbotent gaiement dans leurs bains.

french.enphrase: In France, having one's fireplace swept yearly is a legal obligation.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: En France, faire ramoner sa cheminée annuellement est une obligation légale.

french.enphrase: In small French villages, spending Christmas Eve in church is a custom which has endured since the Middle-Ages.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Dans les petits villages français, la veillée de Noël à l'église est une coutume qui perdure depuis le Moyen-âge.

french.enphrase: Before, this man was rich and successful in business; now he is broke, and panhandles in this park.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Avant, cet homme était riche et heureux en affaires ; maintenant il est ruiné et il fait la manche dans ce parc.

french.enphrase: In 2009, for the 65th anniversary of D-Day in Normandy, the American president came to France.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 1 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: En 2009, à l'occasion du 65e anniversaire du Débarquement en Normandie, le président américain est venu en France.

french.enphrase: For Christmas dinner dessert my mother always bakes her famous homemade Yule log.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Pour le dessert du repas de Noël, ma mère cuisine toujours sa fameuse bûche de Noël faite maison.

french.enphrase: In some towns like Monaco, panhandling is forbidden; the city council doesn't want to frighten away the tourists.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Dans certaines villes comme Monaco, la mendicité est interdite car la municipalité ne veut pas effrayer les touristes.

french.enphrase: "Laziness is an ugly fault" my grandfather used to tell me again and again.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: "La fainéantise est un vilain défaut" me répétait toujours mon grand-père.

french.enphrase: Black pudding is a typical meal from the West Indies, but to enjoy it you need to like spicy food.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le boudin noir est un plat typique des Antilles, mais pour l'apprécier il faut aimer le piment.

french.enphrase: My aunt got a hip replacement; ever since then she enjoys walking again.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ma tante s'est fait poser une prothèse de la hanche ; depuis elle marche à nouveau avec plaisir.

french.enphrase: The river Seine is dotted with canal locks; it is not easy to navigate them when you are a novice on the boat.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La Seine est parsemée d'écluses ; il n'est pas facile de les passer lorsque l'on est débutant sur un bateau.

french.enphrase: They boozed on wine all evening; as a result, they were unable to drive their car to go home.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ils ont picolé du vin toute la soirée ; le résultat fut qu'ils ont été incapables de prendre la voiture pour rentrer chez eux.

french.enphrase: On Halloween night, you can hear the witches giggling deep in the woods.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: A Halloween, on peut entendre les sorcières qui ricanent au fond des bois.

french.enphrase: They were drooling over the huge new house that their neighbors were having built.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ils bavaient d'envie devant la nouvelle maison immense que leurs voisins faisaient construire.

french.enphrase: I missed my train for the fourth time this week; I really must buy an alarm clock.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'ai loupé mon train pour la quatrième fois cette semaine ; il faut vraiment que je m'achète un réveil !

french.enphrase: Things are turning out quite well this month, so I think we will make good sales numbers.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les choses se goupillent plutôt bien ce mois-ci alors je pense que nous ferons un beau chiffre d'affaires.

french.enphrase: I waited in front of the movie theater for two hours, and since he didn't come I ended up going back home!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'ai poiroté pendant deux heures devant le cinéma, et comme il n'est pas venu j'ai fini par rentrer chez moi !

french.enphrase: The police arrested a newly retired couple who were using the internet to rip off tourists by renting them a non-existent apartment.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La police a arrêté un couple de jeunes retraités qui arnaquaient les touristes en leur louant par internet un appartement qui n'existait pas.

french.enphrase: You believe everything she tells you! But you know, her knowledge is not supreme!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Tu crois tout ce qu'elle te dit! Mais tu sais, elle n'a pas la connaissance suprême !

french.enphrase: My cousin is being prosecuted for drunk driving; I sure hope this will teach him a lesson!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mon cousin est poursuivi pour conduite en état d'ivresse ; j'espère bien que ça lui servira de leçon !

french.enphrase: If you leave jam on the table it will be all sticky.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Si tu laisses de la confiture sur la table, ce sera tout poisseux !

french.enphrase: This witness played a predominant role in this affair, and thanks to him, the defendant was acquitted.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ce témoin a joué un rôle prépondérant dans cette affaire et grâce à lui, l'accusé a été acquitté.

french.enphrase: My dog escaped last night, but he must have felt guilty because in the morning he came back all sheepish.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mon chien s'est enfui de la maison la nuit dernière, mais il a dû se sentir coupable car au matin il est revenu tout penaud.

french.enphrase: This actress wore a stunning evening dress, and when she arrived all eyes were on her.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Cette actrice portait une robe du soir éblouissante et à son arrivée, tous les regards étaient tournés vers elle !

french.enphrase: The contract has been respected up to now; therefore I don't see why this should change.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le contrat a été respecté jusqu'ici alors je ne vois pas pourquoi cela devrait changer !

french.enphrase: Schooling in the past was much more difficult than today; it was very hard to get your diploma.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: L'école de naguère était bien plus difficile que celle d'aujourd'hui ; il était très dur d'obtenir son diplôme.

french.enphrase: There are several points to discuss, in particular concerning the rate of import duties.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il y a plusieurs points à revoir, notamment en ce qui concerne le tarif des importations.

french.enphrase: The living room was in such disarray that I first thought there had been a robbery!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le salon était tellement en pagaille que j'ai tout d'abord pensé à un cambriolage !

french.enphrase: After the storm came through, more than half of the houses were partly destroyed.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Après le passage de la tempête plus de la moitié des maisons ont été partiellement détruites.

french.enphrase: The small neighborhood shops cannot compete against the discount stores.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les petites boutiques de quartiers ne font pas le poids face aux magasins bon marchés.

french.enphrase: His wife left on a holiday, but she filled the pantry before leaving.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Sa femme est partie en vacances mais elle a rempli le garde-manger avant son départ.

french.enphrase: Homoeopathy, which is very popular in France, is a natural alternative to cure nervous twitches.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: L'homéopathie qui est très populaire en France est une alternative naturelle pour soigner les tics nerveux.

french.enphrase: Most people will suffer from jet lag when going from Los Angeles to Paris.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 2 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La plupart des gens souffriront du décalage horaire en allant de Los Angeles à Paris.

french.enphrase: The news of this large bank bankruptcy sent a shockwave through the financial world.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La nouvelle de la faillite de cette grande banque a crée une onde de choc dans le milieu de la finance.

french.enphrase: An accident on the Périphérique, the highway encircling Paris, created more than 37 miles of traffic jams this morning.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Un accident sur le périphérique parisien qui entoure Paris a créé plus de 60 kilomètres de bouchons ce matin.

french.enphrase: The president of the local soccer club has been put in jail for embezzlement.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le président du club de foot local a été emprisonné pour détournement de fonds.

french.enphrase: We made our own birth announcements because it is much less expensive and just as nice.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous avons fait nous-mêmes nos faireparts de naissance car c'est beaucoup moins cher et tout aussi joli.

french.enphrase: The company results are due to the combined efforts of all departments.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les résultats de la société sont dûs aux efforts combinés de tous les départements.

french.enphrase: She has had to deal with quite a few problems these last weeks.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Elle a dû faire face à pas mal de problèmes ces dernières semaines.

french.enphrase: After losing the last battle, the soldiers had to build up a new plan for the attack.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Après avoir perdu la dernière bataille, les soldats ont dû échafauder un nouveau plan d'attaque.

french.enphrase: He boasts about being the best on the team but he missed his two last shots!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il se targue d'être l'un des meilleurs de l'équipe mais il a manqué ses deux derniers tirs !

french.enphrase: I saw Mary yesterday; she popped in the store after her yoga class.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'ai vu Marie hier, elle est passée au magasin après son cours de yoga.

french.enphrase: I went to the Louvre last week where I contemplated the Mona Lisa for hours; she is magnificent!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je suis allé au Louvre la semaine dernière où j'ai contemplé la Joconde pendant des heures: elle est magnifique !

french.enphrase: My friends organized a baby shower to celebrate my son's birth where we savored champagne and miniature gourmet cookies.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mes amies ont organisé une fête pour la naissance de mon fils où nous avons dégusté du champagne et des petits fours.

french.enphrase: The police fined my father for driving the wrong way on a one-way street; he was fined 150 Euros.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mon père a été verbalisé parce qu'il prenait un sens interdit ; il a eu une amende de 150 Euros.

french.enphrase: We went to the fair, and I ate so much cotton candy that I got sick!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous sommes allés à la fête foraine et j'ai mangé tant de barbe à papa que j'en suis tombé malade !

french.enphrase: The welfare department is located on the 3rd floor of city hall; they are open five days a week.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les services d'action sociale se situent au troisième étage de la mairie ; ils sont ouverts cinq jours par semaine.

french.enphrase: Patience is a virtue.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La patience est une vertu.

french.enphrase: They must have had many customers because at 11 o'clock their display was almost empty.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ils ont dû avoir de nombreux clients car à 11h leur étalage était déjà presque vide !

french.enphrase: This little shop in the heart of Montmartre sells all sorts of delicacies; they're delicious!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Cette petite boutique au cœur de Montmartre vend des gourmandises de toutes sortes, elles sont délicieuses !

french.enphrase: Look at these two dancers; their rhythm is much too fast for the majority of people.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Regardes ces deux danseurs ; leur cadence est bien trop rapide pour la majorité des gens.

french.enphrase: We decided to sell my grandmother's furniture at auction.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous avons décidé de vendre les meubles de ma grand-mère lors d'une vente aux enchères.

french.enphrase: We asked for a quote, and the cost overall is less expensive than expected.
