french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous avons fait faire un devis et le coût dans l'ensemble est bien moins cher que prévu.

french.enphrase: He went into wholesale three years ago, and never had to regret his choice.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il s'est lancé dans le commerce de gros il y a 3 ans et il n'a jamais eu à regretter son choix.

french.enphrase: Have you heard about the new trend? It's a dance that comes from Italy.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: As-tu entendu parler de la dernière tendance ? C'est une danse venue d'Italie.

french.enphrase: If you don't put money in the parking meter every two hours you'll certainly get a fine.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Si tu ne mets pas d'argent dans l'horodateur toutes les deux heures tu auras certainement une amende.

french.enphrase: This artist's latest work is a stately sculpture which will be exhibited in the hall of the Court of Law.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La dernière œuvre de cet artiste est une sculpture majestueuse qui sera exposée dans le hall du palais de justice.

french.enphrase: Their interior is very classy; I'd really like to know who helped them to do it.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Leur intérieur est très chic ; j'aimerais bien savoir qui les a aidés à le réaliser.

french.enphrase: If you want to organize your own wedding, I can suggest some articles I know.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Si vous voulez organiser votre mariage vous-mêmes, je peux vous suggérer diverses lectures que je connais.

french.enphrase: After meeting him, she was so upset that she didn't want to talk to anybody!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Après l'avoir rencontré, elle était si énervée qu'elle ne voulait plus parler à personne !

french.enphrase: My aunt likes to travel in a quiet environment; that's why she always brings her earplugs.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 3 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ma tante aime voyager au calme ; voilà pourquoi elle emmène toujours ses boules Quies.

french.enphrase: After a worrisome financial crisis, one can see an economic rebound these past few months.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Après une crise financière inquiétante, on peut constater un rebond dans l'économie ces derniers mois.

french.enphrase: The government is sending more and more police patrols as a backup.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le gouvernement envoie de plus en plus de patrouilles de police en soutien.

french.enphrase: Elderly people need to be looked after very carefully during a heat wave.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les personnes âgées ont besoin d'une attention particulière en période de canicule.

french.enphrase: They hired a very expensive caterer for their wedding, and the food was of a very high quality.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Pour leur mariage, ils ont pris un traiteur très cher et la nourriture était de très bonne qualité.

french.enphrase: This man really tells stories to women; he invents everything he says.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Cet homme est un véritable affabulateur avec les femmes ; il invente tout ce qu'il dit.

french.enphrase: I'm sorry but I don't have any small change; would you take a 20€ bill?
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je suis désolée mais je n'ai pas l'appoint ; prendriez-vous un billet de 20€ ?

french.enphrase: The stronger the waves, the more foam there is, which often scares children.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Plus les vagues sont fortes, plus il y a d'écume, ce qui effraie souvent les enfants.

french.enphrase: We have cockroaches in the kitchen!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous avons des cafards dans la cuisine !

french.enphrase: It's not easy to be a freshman.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il n'est pas aisé d'être bizut.

french.enphrase: There was a light fog over the road.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il y avait une légère brume sur la route.

french.enphrase: Frankness is one quality I appreciate; it's not worth hiding what you really think.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La franchise est une qualité que j'apprécie ; il ne sert à rien de cacher ce que l'on pense vraiment.

french.enphrase: In this company, the secretary quit, and then filed a suit for sexual harassment.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Dans cette entreprise, la secrétaire a démissionné puis a porté plainte pour harcèlement sexuel.

french.enphrase: This movie about World War II was so touching that I couldn't help crying before the end.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ce film sur la seconde guerre mondiale était si émouvant que je n'ai pas pu m'empêcher de pleurer avant la fin.

french.enphrase: After a long investigation, the senator was restored to favor in his functions and in everyone's mind.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Après une longue enquête, le sénateur a été réhabilité dans ses fonctions et aux yeux de tous.

french.enphrase: Please, don't feel sorry! It was just a harmless incident, and I don't even think about it anymore!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ne t'excuses pas, je t'en prie ! C'était un incident tout à fait anodin et je n'y pense même plus !

french.enphrase: When I saw his swollen face, I guessed right away that he had fought with someone.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Quand j'ai vu son visage tuméfié j'ai aussitôt deviné qu'il s'était battu.

french.enphrase: The meeting was shortened by the fire alarm; we'll have to postpone it to next month.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La réunion a été abrégée par le déclenchement de l'alarme incendie, nous devrons donc la reporter au mois prochain.

french.enphrase: In her youth, she was a beauty, but with time her charms have faded.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: C'était une reine de beauté dans sa jeunesse, mais ses charmes se sont peu à peu étiolés.

french.enphrase: I hated that wine; I don't know its origin, but I'm quite sure that it is adulterated.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'ai détesté ce vin ; je ne connais pas son origine mais je suis quasiment sûr qu'il est frelaté.

french.enphrase: My parents have a country house near Versailles; it's a quiet and peaceful place.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mes parents ont une maison de campagne près de Versailles, c'est un endroit calme et paisible.

french.enphrase: He's in his fifties, but he doesn't look it!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il est quinquagénaire mais il n'en a pas l'air !

french.enphrase: I really appreciate this fashion designer's style even if some people think he's a bit old-fashioned.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'apprécie vraiment le style de ce couturier même si certains le trouvent un peu suranné.

french.enphrase: When we went to the Dominican Republic, I really enjoyed meeting the natives.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Lorsque nous avons visité la République Dominicaine, j'ai beaucoup aimé rencontrer les autochtones.

french.enphrase: Celebrities hit by the gossip papers often have to publish denials to reassure their families.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les stars attaquées par la presse à scandale doivent souvent publier des démentis pour rassurer leurs familles.

french.enphrase: He is so deceitful; no one trusts him any longer.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il est tellement fourbe ; personne ne lui fait plus confiance maintenant.

french.enphrase: They were astonished to discover that their travel guide was a smuggler.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ils ont découvert avec stupéfaction que leur guide de voyage était un contrebandier.

french.enphrase: There was an oversight in this investigation, and this inspector really intends to complete it.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il y a eu une omission dans cette enquête et cet inspecteur compte bien la compléter.

french.enphrase: My mother used to tell me not to behave so nonchalantly and to be more lively.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 4 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ma mère me disait souvent d'agir moins nonchalamment et d'être plus dynamique.

french.enphrase: The dance teacher shows the choreography and then asks his students to do likewise.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le professeur de danse montre la chorégraphie et puis demande à ses élèves de faire pareillement.

french.enphrase: During the holidays I cook for her, and she eats my cakes with delight.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je cuisine pour elle pendant les vacances et elle mange mes petits gâteaux avec délice.

french.enphrase: I no longer need your help whatsoever; therefore you can leave if you wish.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je n'ai aucunement besoin de ton aide ; tu peux donc t'en aller si tu le souhaites.

french.enphrase: Sometimes it is easier to learn foreign languages by playing games than scholastically.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il est parfois plus facile d'apprendre les langues par le jeu que scolairement.

french.enphrase: At first glance she might seem rather cold, but truly, once you know her, she is the funniest!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Elle peut paraître assez froide de prime abord mais vraiment, lorsque tu la connais, elle est tout ce qu'il y a de plus drôle !

french.enphrase: In the past, people used to punish the thieves by cutting off their hands.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Autrefois on châtiait les voleurs en leur coupant les mains.

french.enphrase: He planned a very romantic evening for Valentine's Day.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il a prévu une soirée très romantique pour la Saint-Valentin.

french.enphrase: She offered him a beautiful box of chocolates.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Elle lui a offert une magnifique boîte de chocolats.

french.enphrase: I like it when you whisper words of love in my ear.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'aime lorsque tu chuchotes des mots d'amour à mon oreille.

french.enphrase: This silk dress suits you very well.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Cette robe en soie te va très bien.

french.enphrase: You are dazzling tonight.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Tu es radieuse ce soir.

french.enphrase: We are going to uncork a good bottle of wine to celebrate that.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous allons déboucher une bonne bouteille de vin pour fêter cela.

french.enphrase: The bouquet of flowers you sent me on Monday is still superb.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le bouquet de fleurs que tu m'as envoyé lundi est encore superbe.

french.enphrase: I often think of him despite the distance.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je pense souvent à lui malgré la distance.

french.enphrase: She loves perfumes made of white flowers.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Elle aime les parfums à base de fleurs blanches.

french.enphrase: Today, Dad is cooking: it will be pasta!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Aujourd'hui c'est papa qui cuisine : ce sera des pâtes !

french.enphrase: Her house is, as usual, very well decorated.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Sa maison est, comme toujours, très bien décorée.

french.enphrase: My daughter has already written her letter to Santa.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ma fille a déjà écrit sa lettre au père Noël.

french.enphrase: Grandma knit me a sweater in angora wool.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Grand-mère m'a tricoté un pull en laine angora.

french.enphrase: A very tall fir has been installed in the middle of the square.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Un très grand sapin a été installé au milieu de la place.

french.enphrase: During winter we like to make a fire in the fireplace.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: En hiver, nous aimons faire du feu dans la cheminée.

french.enphrase: The sky is completely white; it's going to snow.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le ciel est tout blanc, il va neiger.

french.enphrase: In the mountains, it is very cold at this altitude.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: En montagne, il fait très froid à cette altitude.

french.enphrase: I find the holiday season's atmosphere truly magical.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je trouve l'ambiance des fêtes de fin d'année vraiment magique.

french.enphrase: After hesitating, she finally chose the golden wreath.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Après avoir hésité, elle a finalement choisi la guirlande dorée.

french.enphrase: What about inviting my parents for Christmas?
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Et si l'on invitait mes parents pour Noël ?

french.enphrase: The Christmas shop windows are beautiful this year.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les vitrines de Noël sont magnifiques cette année.

french.enphrase: I'm looking for the box of Christmas decorations, have you seen it?
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 5 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je cherche le carton des décorations de Noël, ne l'aurais-tu pas vu ?

french.enphrase: She forgot her scarf on a subway bench.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Elle a oublié son écharpe sur un banc de métro.

french.enphrase: The village is illuminated throughout the holiday season.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le village est illuminé pendant toute la saison des fêtes.

french.enphrase: Christmas will be here shortly; only a few more days of waiting, children!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Noël sera bientôt là: plus que quelques jours d'attente, les enfants !

french.enphrase: Be careful not to slip, there's black ice.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Fais attention à ne pas glisser, il y a du verglas.

french.enphrase: I found an original gift for each of my friends.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'ai trouvé un cadeau original pour chacun de mes amis.

french.enphrase: We are going to offer Mom a beautiful book about Iceland.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous allons offrir à maman un beau livre sur l'Islande.

french.enphrase: I finally have a good gift idea for your grandfather.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'ai enfin une bonne idée de cadeau pour ton grand-père.

french.enphrase: We are going to eat way too much during the holidays.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous allons beaucoup trop manger pendant les fêtes.

french.enphrase: I haven't sent any greeting cards yet.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je n'ai encore envoyé aucune carte de vœux.

french.enphrase: You have two days left to find your last gifts.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il vous reste deux jours pour trouver vos derniers cadeaux.

french.enphrase: Don't forget to thank Aunt Michèle, she really spoiled you.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Tu n'oublieras pas de remercier tante Michèle, elle t'a vraiment gâtée.

french.enphrase: Damn, I have lost one of my gloves again!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Zut, j'ai encore perdu un de mes gants !

french.enphrase: We went for a walk at night under a beautiful starry sky.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous sommes allés nous promener de nuit, sous un beau ciel étoilé.

french.enphrase: Marie brought us some chocolate candies, do you want to taste them?
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Marie nous a apporté des papillotes, veux-tu les goûter ?

french.enphrase: We wish you an excellent year 2015 !
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous vous souhaitons une excellente année 2015 !

french.enphrase: The children are playing in the snow.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les enfants jouent dans la neige.

french.enphrase: It is really dark today.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il fait vraiment sombre aujourd'hui.

french.enphrase: The night falls very early in the winter.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: La nuit tombe très tôt en hiver.

french.enphrase: She has circled her birthday date on my calendar.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Elle a entouré la date de son anniversaire sur mon calendrier.

french.enphrase: My 2015 New Year's resolution: learn Russian.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ma bonne résolution pour 2015: apprendre le russe.

french.enphrase: The sweater she knit for me is way too short.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le pull qu'elle m'a tricotée est beaucoup trop court.

french.enphrase: After the holiday's excesses, he wants to go on a diet.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Après les excès des fêtes, il veut se mettre au régime.

french.enphrase: I don't like to drive when it snows.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je n'aime pas conduire quand il neige.

french.enphrase: Jeanne has put on her snow boots to keep her feet warm.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Jeanne a mis ses bottes fourrées pour avoir bien chaud aux pieds.

french.enphrase: Mom has already stored the Christmas decorations.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Maman a déjà rangé les décorations de Noël.

french.enphrase: His mulled wine is not spicy enough.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Son vin chaud n'est pas assez épicé.

french.enphrase: According to etiquette, you have to send your greetings before the end of February.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 6 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Selon l'étiquette, il faut envoyer ses vœux avant la fin du mois de février.

french.enphrase: I still have not answered all the greeting cards I have received.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je n'ai pas encore répondu à toutes les cartes que j'ai reçues.

french.enphrase: He's going to ask his boss for a raise for the new year.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il va demander une augmentation à son chef pour la nouvelle année.

french.enphrase: I hope that 2016 will be a year of peace in the world.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'espère que 2016 sera une année de paix dans le monde.

french.enphrase: We settled around the fireplace to talk.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous nous sommes installés autour de la cheminée pour discuter.

french.enphrase: I'm going to make a donation to UNICEF for illiterate children.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Je vais faire un don à l'UNICEF en faveur des enfants illettrés.

french.enphrase: Put your hat on, you are going to catch cold!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Mets ton bonnet, tu vas attraper froid!

french.enphrase: I love the hood of your coat.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'aime beaucoup la capuche de ton manteau.

french.enphrase: Close the door behind you, it's cold!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Fermez la porte derrière vous, il fait froid!

french.enphrase: The book you offered to me was exciting: I've finished it.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le livre que tu m'as offert était passionnant: je l'ai terminé.

french.enphrase: We're renting a cabin for the family to go skiing.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous louons un chalet pour aller faire du ski en famille.

french.enphrase: You have a snowflake on your nose!
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Tu as un flocon sur le bout du nez !

french.enphrase: I'm taking my daughter to ski in the Alps.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: J'emmène ma fille skier dans les Alpes.

french.enphrase: Mont-Blanc made Chamonix famous throughout the whole world.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Le Mont-Blanc a rendu Chamonix célèbre dans le monde entier.

french.enphrase: Your gift really pleases me, thank you.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Ton cadeau me plaît énormément, merci.

french.enphrase: Mountain roads can be dangerous.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les routes de montagnes peuvent être dangereuses.

french.enphrase: The black slopes are the most difficult ones.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Les pistes noires sont les plus difficiles de toutes.

french.enphrase: We stayed in a hotel at the bottom of the slopes.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous avons séjourné dans un hôtel au pied des pistes.

french.enphrase: She broke her arm in a skiing accident.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Elle s'est cassé le bras lors d'une chute à ski.

french.enphrase: We went to see the icy waterfall.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous sommes allés voir la cascade de glace.

french.enphrase: Several paths lead to the summit.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Plusieurs chemins mènent au sommet.

french.enphrase: We make pancakes for Shrove Tuesday.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Nous faisons des crêpes pour Mardi Gras.

french.enphrase: He was disguised as a pirate for Carnival.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il s'est déguisé en pirate pour le Carnaval.

french.enphrase: He skis way too fast, he might fall.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Il skie beaucoup trop vite, il risque de tomber.

french.enphrase: Today is the Chinese New Year.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Aujourd'hui, c'est le nouvel an chinois.

french.enphrase: We meet around 4 pm to drink a hot chocolate.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: On se retrouve vers 16 heures pour boire un chocolat chaud.

french.enphrase: February is the shortest month of the year.
french.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 7 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
french.fnphrase: Février est le plus court des mois de l'année.
